intro: Stewartia mangshanica, commonly known as the Mangshan stewartia, is a rare and ornamental evergreen tree native to China. It belongs to the Theaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and elliptical, dark green leaves. The tree produces small, white, fragrant flowers in the spring, followed by ornamental red berries in the fall. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions with cool, humid climates. Due to its limited distribution and unique beauty, it is considered a valuable species for botanical gardens and conservation efforts.
